Package DAO

Class JDBC

java.lang.Object
DAO.JDBC
public abstract class JDBC extends Object
This Java Database Connection class connects to the local database and sends queries to the database to create, read, update, and delete data. The methods for opening and closing the database connection are paraphrased from code snippets from WGU course C195 code repository.

  • Method Details

    • openConnection

      public static void openConnection()
      Opens connection to the database using attributes locally saved in this class.

    • closeConnection

      public static void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection to the database.

    • validateUsernameAndPassword

      public static boolean validateUsernameAndPassword(String usernameAttempt, String passwordAttempt) throws SQLException
      This method checks the provided username and password against the usernames and associated passwords in the database.
      Parameters:
      usernameAttempt - - the username provided by the user on the login form
      passwordAttempt - - the password provided by the user on the login form
      Returns:
      a boolean pertaining to the validity of the username and associated password provided by the user compared to the database.
      Throws:
      SQLException - from the SQL executeQuery of the statement via database connection - exception handled in Login

    • listOfAppointmentsAll

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> listOfAppointmentsAll() throws SQLException
      This method queries a list of all appointments.
      Returns:
      an observable list of appointments with the specifications of the query
      Throws:
      SQLException - from the SQL executeQuery of the statement via database connection - exception handled in ApplicationMain

    • listOfAppointments

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> listOfAppointments(String userName) throws SQLException
      This method queries a list of upcoming appointments for a specific username.
      Parameters:
      userName - - the username being used in the query
      Returns:
      an observable list of appointments with the specifications of the query
      Throws:
      SQLException - from the SQL executeQuery of the statement via database connection - exception handled in ApplicationMain

    • appointmentsExistWithin15MinTimeFrameForUser

      public static boolean appointmentsExistWithin15MinTimeFrameForUser()
      This method indicates if an appointment for the user exists within 15 minutes of the current time.
      Returns:
      - a boolean that indicates whether an appointment exists for the user within 15 minutes of the current time.

    • appointmentWithin15MinTimeFrameForUser

      public static String appointmentWithin15MinTimeFrameForUser()
      This method creates a string with the Appointment ID and start time for the appointment within 15 minutes for the user.
      Returns:
      - a string with the Appointment ID and start time of the appointment within 15 minutes for the user.

    • appointmentsExistWithinTimeFrameForCustomer

      public static boolean appointmentsExistWithinTimeFrameForCustomer(String start, String end, String customerID)
      This method executes a query to see if an appointment already exists for a certain customer within the time frame provided. This method is for new appointments only.
      Parameters:
      start - - the start date and time provided to be checked, date and time provided in UTC timezone.
      end - - the end date and time provided to be checked, date and time provided in UTC timezone.
      customerID - - the ID number of the customer provided, should be supplied stored as a string.
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if an appointment already exists for the customer ID provided that overlaps with the start and end dates provided.

    • appointmentsExistWithinTimeFrameForCustomer

      public static boolean appointmentsExistWithinTimeFrameForCustomer(String start, String end, String customerID, int appointmentID)
      This overloaded method executes a query to see if an appointment already exists for a certain customer within the time frame provided. This method is for updating appointments only, not new appointments.
      Parameters:
      start - - the start date and time provided to be checked, date and time provided in UTC timezone.
      end - - the end date and time provided to be checked, date and time provided in UTC timezone.
      customerID - - the ID number of the customer provided, should be supplied stored as a string.
      appointmentID - - the ID number of the appointment being updated (so it can be excluded from the search).
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating if an appointment already exists for the customer ID provided that overlaps with the start and end dates provided.

    • addNewAppointment

      public static boolean addNewAppointment(String title, String desc, String location, String type, String start, String end, String customerID, String userID, String contactID)
      This method executes a query to add a new appointment. Appointments will need to be validated before this method is called.
      Parameters:
      title - - title of appointment
      desc - - description of appointment
      location - - location of appointment
      type - - type of appointment
      start - - start date and time of appointment
      end - - end date and time of appointment
      customerID - - customer ID associated with appointment
      userID - - user ID associated with appointment
      contactID - - contact ID associated with appointment
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if new appointment was added correctly

    • updateAppointment

      public static boolean updateAppointment(int appID, String title, String desc, String location, String type, String start, String end, String customerID, String userID, String contactID)
      This method executes a query to update an appointment. Updates will need to be validated before this method is called.
      Parameters:
      appID - - ID number of the appointment
      title - - title of appointment
      desc - - description of appointment
      location - - location of appointment
      type - - type of appointment
      start - - start date and time of appointment
      end - - end date and time of appointment
      customerID - - customer ID associated with appointment
      userID - - user ID associated with appointment
      contactID - - contact ID associated with appointment
      Returns:
      boolean indicating if new appointment was added correctly

    • deleteAppointment

      public static boolean deleteAppointment(int appointmentID)
      This method executes a query to remove an appointment.
      Parameters:
      appointmentID - = The ID number of the appointment to be removed.
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating whether or not the appointment was removed.

    • listOfCustomers

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> listOfCustomers() throws SQLException
      This method executes a query to pull a list of customers and their associated information.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing customers.
      Throws:
      SQLException - - from the SQL executeQuery of the statement via database connection - exception handled in ApplicationMain

    • listOfCustomerNames

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> listOfCustomerNames()
      This method executes a query to pull a list of customers and their IDs as a string with a comma delimiter.
      Returns:
      - an Observable List of customers and their IDs as strings with a comma delimiter

    • addNewCustomer

      public static boolean addNewCustomer(String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int division)
      This method executes an update statement to add a new customer.
      Parameters:
      name - - customer name
      address - - customer address
      postalCode - - customer postal code
      phone - - customer phone
      division - - customer division
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the customer was added successfully

    • updateCustomer

      public static boolean updateCustomer(int customerID, String name, String address, String postalCode, String phone, int division)
      This method executes an update statement to update a customer.
      Parameters:
      customerID - - customer ID
      name - - customer name
      address - - customer address
      postalCode - - customer postal code
      phone - - customer phone
      division - - customer division
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the customer was updated successfully

    • deleteCustomer

      public static boolean deleteCustomer(int customerID)
      This method executes an update statement to delete a customer.
      Parameters:
      customerID - - customer ID
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the customer was successfully deleted.

    • customerHasAppointmentsCheck

      public static boolean customerHasAppointmentsCheck(int customerID)
      This method executes a query to check if a provided customer has any associated appointments.
      Parameters:
      customerID - - customer ID of customer to check
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the customer has appointments

    • listOfFirstLvlDivisions

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> listOfFirstLvlDivisions(String countryID)
      This method executes a query to pull a list of all first level divisions and their IDs for a provided country.
      Parameters:
      countryID - - country ID to identify provided country
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all first level divisions and their IDs.

    • report1AppointmentsByMonthAndType

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> report1AppointmentsByMonthAndType()
      This method executes a query for a count of appointments by type and by month for report 1.
      Returns:
      - an Observable List of appointments containing their type, month, and count frequency.

    • report2ScheduleByContact

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Appointment> report2ScheduleByContact(String contactName)
      This method executes a query for the schedule of a provided contact for report 2.
      Parameters:
      contactName - - The contact name to query for their schedule
      Returns:
      - an Observable List of appointments for the provided contact

    • report3CountCustomersByCountryAndDivision

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> report3CountCustomersByCountryAndDivision()
      This method executes a query for a count of customers by country and by division for report 3.
      Returns:
      an Observable List of customers containing their country, division, and count frequency

    • listOfContactNames

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> listOfContactNames()
      This method executes a query for a list of Contact names and IDs.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all contact names and IDs concatenated with a delimiter of a comma and a space.

    • listOfUserNames

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> listOfUserNames()
      This method executes a query for a list of Usernames and IDs.
      Returns:
      an ObservableList containing all Usernames and IDs concatenated with a delimiter of a comma and a space.
